tournament.name: MKM Series 2017 Frankfurt - Modern Main Event

decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of creatures, powered by artifact synergy and buffs like Cranial Plating. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless attack, leveraging cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager to pump up your creatures while using cards like Etched Champion and Master of Etherium to protect and enhance them further. The deck also utilizes efficient removal with Galvanic Blast and card draw with Thoughtcast, maintaining a balance between aggression and control to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing its own life total to boost the power of Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf while using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The addition of cards like Grim Flayer and Temur Battle Rage provide additional aggression and reach, while the deck also includes ways to search for specific cards and generate card advantage with Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to operate smoothly and apply pressure from the early turns of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat while also utilizing hand disruption spells to control the opponent's resources. Tarmogoyf provides additional pressure alongside Death's Shadow, while cards like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay help to deal with opposing threats. Liliana of the Veil offers both control and discard effects, while Temur Battle Rage can help push through additional damage. The deck also includes creature removal in the form of Tarfire and Kolaghan's Command, offering a versatile toolkit for aggressive gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug. By combining cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to continually mill the top cards of the library, the deck aims to bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast from the graveyard onto the battlefield. This creates a strong board presence and allows for explosive plays, especially when combined with cards like Conflagrate and Life from the Loam for additional value.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on ramping up with Eldrazi Temple and Urza lands to play big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game. It also includes control elements like Chalice of the Void and Dismember to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and land destruction effects while using cards like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon as versatile answers to a variety of threats. Sea Gate Wreckage provides card advantage in longer games, while Batterskull and Basilisk Collar offer additional utility and lifegain.

The core strategy of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's draws and plays using Lantern of Insight to see and manipulate their top card, along with cards like Pithing Needle and Ensnaring Bridge to lock down threats. The deck also includes hand disruption, graveyard hate, and removal spells to further control the game. In addition, the deck runs utility lands like Inventors' Fair and Academy Ruins to recur key pieces and find necessary cards. Overall, the deck aims to grind down the opponent's resources and win through attrition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various spells and removal, while also setting up for a game-winning Scapeshift combo. By ramping up mana, searching for specific lands, countering opponent's spells, and removing threats from the board, the deck aims to survive long enough to play Scapeshift and fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with multiple Mountains, dealing lethal damage to the opponent in one turn. Platinum Emperion and Madcap Experiment provide additional protection and win conditions, making the deck resilient and versatile in different matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, bouncing threats back to their hand, and destroying creatures. It also ramps up mana quickly using spells like Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder to reach its win condition, Scapeshift. By fetching lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains, the deck aims to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one big combo turn. The deck also has versatile removal spells and card draw options to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly lower your own life total to pump up Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf, then use efficient removal spells and hand disruption to control the game. The deck aims to be aggressive and put pressure on the opponent early on, while also having the ability to grind out value with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Kolaghan's Command. By efficiently managing your life total and resources, you aim to overwhelm your opponent and win through a combination of creature beats and disruption.

The key concept of this UW Control deck is to slow down and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw until it can establish control of the game. The deck aims to control the battlefield with cards like Cryptic Command and Supreme Verdict, while also maximizing card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Esper Charm. By efficiently managing resources and controlling the tempo of the game, the deck can outvalue and outlast its opponents in longer matches.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow to get out Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan. By combining the landfall triggers of Valakut with Primeval Titan's ability to search for more Mountains, the player can deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn by sacrificing lands with Scapeshift. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to control the board while setting up the combo.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while applying early pressure through aggressive creatures. It contains cards that tax the opponent's mana and prevent easy searches, in addition to creatures that provide value when they enter or leave the battlefield. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and resilient creatures like Kitchen Finks. Aether Vial allows for incremental advantage by cheating creatures into play at instant speed. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a well-rounded aggro plan while disrupting their game plan.

This deck aims to efficiently search for and assemble a specific combination of creatures that can generate infinite mana and/or effectively control the board. By utilizing a toolbox of creatures with abilities that complement each other, the deck can adapt to various game scenarios and combo off to win the game in a single turn. The deck combines creature-based ramp, card advantage, and combo pieces to create a versatile and resilient strategy that can overwhelm opponents with its flexibility and power.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble a combination of creatures that work together synergistically to gain incremental advantages and overpower the opponent. The deck uses creature tutor cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to search for specific creatures in the deck and put them directly onto the battlefield. These creatures include both utility creatures like Qasali Pridemage and Eternal Witness, as well as combo creatures like Spike Feeder and Archangel of Thune, which can create an infinite life gain loop. By leveraging the toolbox of creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while disrupting their game plan.

This Modern deck focuses on using Death's Shadow as a key threat, quickly lowering its own life total to make Death's Shadow a powerful, low-cost creature. The deck includes a mix of disruptive and removal spells to control the board while applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer. The deck also utilizes Traverse the Ulvenwald to find specific creatures or lands as needed. Overall, the deck aims to win games through a combination of early aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost artifacts to quickly assemble a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Cards like Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating help boost the power of creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest. Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum help ramp up mana production, while Steel Overseer provides a way to pump up all artifact creatures on the board. The deck also includes some buffs like Master of Etherium and Etched Champion to further strengthen the team, making it a fast and formidable threat in the Modern format.
